video.title: Rock the Park
video.synopsis: A tour of America's beloved national parks brings the show's hosts face-to-face with nature in some of the most awe-inspiring places on Earth.

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton observe the massive brown bears of Katmai National Park in Alaska, home to the largest population of brown bears on the planet.
episodes.title: Katmai National Park: Where the Bears Are

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton experience nature's awesome power in Alaska, where they kayak with whales and sea otters, then witness glaciers crashing into the sea.
episodes.title: Glacier Bay: White Thunder

episodes.synopsis: The hosts are pushed to their limits when they go off the beaten path for a climb up the "American Alps" in Washington's North Cascades National Park.
episodes.title: North Cascades: Life on the Edge

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton explore the diverse flora and fauna of Olympic National Park, which encompasses rain forest, rocky coast and mountains.
episodes.title: Olympic: Obstacles and Animals

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton trudge through miles of volcanic ash and a treacherous river in search of one of the most powerful volcanoes on earth.
episodes.title: Katmai: Journey to the Volcano

episodes.synopsis: In their home state of Minnesota, the hosts paddle their way by canoe through interconnected lakes and live like the voyageurs of centuries past.
episodes.title: Voyageurs: Living off the Land

episodes.synopsis: As they head high into the Rocky Mountains and cross the continental divide, Jack and Colton prepare for a possible encounter with grizzly bears.
episodes.title: Glacier National Park: Rock Mountain High

episodes.synopsis: The hosts travel the epic Going-to-the-Sun Road of Glacier National Park, where they have a run-in with a bear and a showdown with bighorn sheep.
episodes.title: Glacier National Park: Bears, Big Horns, and Glaciers

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton take on Old Rag, one of the most dangerous trails in Shenandoah National Park, then belay each other 110 feet up a rock cliff.
episodes.title: Shenandoah: Climbing Virginia Rocks

episodes.synopsis: The guys creep for miles through the caverns of Mammoth Cave National Park and help researchers capture wild bats to track a deadly disease.
episodes.title: Mammoth Cave: All About the Bats

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton trek miles through an icy cold river, then hold on for dear life while climbing one of Zion National Park's most daunting trails.
episodes.title: Red Rock Canyons High and Narrow

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton saddle up and check out the land of hoodoos in Utah's Bryce Canyon, then go back-country camping without a tent.
episodes.title: Bryce Canyon, Horses, Hoodoos, and Mud Water

episodes.synopsis: At Yellowstone, Jack and Colton learn about the volcano that lies beneath the park and creates its hot spots, then track the area's elusive wolves.
episodes.title: Yellowstone National Park: Hot Spots and Wildlife

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton experience the power of the Yellowstone River, with its towering waterfalls and white-water rapids.
episodes.title: Yellowstone: Old Park, New Views

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton trek through the land of giants in Sequoia National Park, then face their fears with a 150-foot climb up a sheer granite wall.
episodes.title: Sequoia: In the Land of Giants

episodes.synopsis: Jack and Colton head to Death Valley National Park in search of one of the scarcest resources there: water.
episodes.title: Death Valley: Destination Desert

episodes.synopsis: It's a rocky ride for Colton and Jack as they explore the Chasm of Doom, then climb the Eye of the Cyclops in Joshua Tree National Park.
episodes.title: Joshua Tree: The Climber's Paradise

episodes.synopsis: Colton and Jack fly high and ride low while exploring the house of the sun in Haleakala National Park on the island of Maui.
episodes.title: Haleakala: In the House of the Sun

episodes.synopsis: Battling altitude sickness and the threat of severe weather, Jack and Colton take on Hawaii's Mauna Loa, the largest volcano on Earth.
episodes.title: Hawai'i Volcanoes: Trekking Mauna Loa

episodes.synopsis: The hosts slog their way through the sloughs of Everglades National Park, then embark on a kayak adventure in the Gulf Coast's remote keys.
episodes.title: Everglades: Slough Slogging and Sea Kayaking

episodes.synopsis: At Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, the guys "chill out" in a snow trench before taking on the challenge of climbing a 70-foot ice wall.
episodes.title: Pictured Rocks: Sleds and Snow Beds

episodes.synopsis: In the largest urban national park in America, the hosts try mountain biking and hit the beach for their first surfing adventure.
episodes.title: Santa Monica Mountains: From Canyons to Coast

episodes.synopsis: Hosts Jack Steward and Colton Smith relive some of their best wildlife encounters in the nation's national parks.
episodes.title: Best of Wildlife

episodes.synopsis: When it comes to finding food and shelter, Jack and Colton haven't always had an easy time of it while camping in America's national parks.
episodes.title: Best of Eat, Drink, Sleep

episodes.synopsis: This compilation captures the best moments of Jack and Colton's encounters with bears, from Alaska to the Rocky Mountains of Wyoming and Montana.
episodes.title: Best of Bears

episodes.synopsis: Catch highlights from Jack and Colton's forays into such legendary locations as Yellowstone, Mammoth Cave and the world's largest volcano in Hawaii.
episodes.title: Best of Adventures
